xpmt:dependency.xpmt:reason: The test case applies to XML 1.1. X(ml)² does not support XML version 1.1
The test case is not applied for the XPath 3.1 specification. The X(ml)² XPath engine supports only XPath 3.1.
The test case requires static type analyzes. Static typing is not supported by the X(ml)² XPath engine
The test case has to be evaluated in the XPath 1.0 compatibility mode. XPath 1.0 compatibility mode is not supported by the X(ml)² XPath engine.
The test case requires dynamic XQuery evaluation. This is not supported by the underlying Saxon-HE.
The test case requires Schema-awareness. This is not supported by the underlying Saxon-HE.
The test case requires Schema-awareness. This is not supported by the underlying Saxon-HE.
The test case requires support of the advanced UCA collation format. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support this.
The test case requires Schema-awareness. This is not supported by the underlying Saxon-HE.
The test case assumes a specific language support. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support out of the box other languages than "en".
The test case assumes a specific language support. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support out of the box other languages than "en".
The test case assumes a specific language support. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support out of the box other languages than "en".
The test case assumes a specific language support. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support out of the box other languages than "en".
The test case an active Saxon feature Feature.STABLE_UNPARSED_TEXT. This feature leads to problems in the test harness.
The test case is not applied for the XPath 3.1 specification. The X(ml)² XPath engine supports only XPath 3.1.
The test case contains a bad construct of nested comments. Comments nested in comments are ignored by the XPM parser.
Saxon-HE throws FOUT1170 instead of FOUT1190! See https://saxonica.plan.io/issues/5952#note-8
This test case requires a specific environment variable. As it is hard to ensure that an env variable is set by the calling system, this test case is ignored.

This test case requires a specific collation format. The underlying Saxon-HE does not support this collation format. See https://www.saxonica.com/html/documentation12/localization/unicode-collation-algorithm/index.html.
This test cases leads to a unresolved Java heap size problem.
Issue with cp protocol: see https://github.com/cmarchand/cp-protocol/issues/1
There is a known bug in the QT3 testsuite: https://github.com/w3c/qt3tests/issues/64
This testcase handles behavior of the processor if XSLT is not supported. The feature XSLT by the XPath engine is always active.
This testcase handles behavior of the processor if XSLT is not supported. The feature XSLT by the XPath engine is always active.

This test case requires a unicode normalization form "FULLY-NORMALIZED" This is not supported by the underlying Saxon processor: "Saxon supports normalization forms NFC, NFD, NFKC, and NFKD" (https://www.saxonica.com/documentation12/index.html#!functions/fn/normalize-unicode).
